Summary: light moving at terrific speed, very high, changed direction 90 deg abruptly, NOT on a curve.
divs: Sighting DetailsTaking a break from an all-night card sesion, about 2-00am my friend and I went outside for some fresh air. It was a crystal clear night and on looking up at the stars, saw a bright light - a shade more yellow than a star, moving at very high speed. We both remarked "He's moving fast", thinking it was an aeroplane. It then did a 90 degree turn, though "turn" is the wrong word. Without slowing down it sped off its original course at an acute 90 degrees and disappeared after traveling a short distance. My friend and I looked at each other and quickly went indoors. The "turn" wasn't a turn as an aircraft would make, and I still know of nothing on this earth that can make a acute 90 degree change in direction without slowing down. The object appeared to be a fraction larger than the North Star. Hard to guess the height - maybe 60,000ft. Neither of us had been drinking, or taking any drugs. I estimate the object was traveling from north to south when first seen, then abruptly turned west and vanished. I have never heard of a UFO making such a change in direction which is why I have never reported this happening before. There was no sound during the event.
